sub_strands.name: Elements and Compounds
descriptions: Physical and chemical properties of elements and compounds
Differences between elements and compounds
Uses of common elements and compounds in everyday life
learning_outcomes: Describe properties of elements and compounds
Distinguish between elements and compounds
Appreciate the importance of elements and compounds in real life
learning_experiences: Group discussion on types and properties of elements and compounds
Carry out activities to observe properties of elements and compounds
Differentiate elements and compounds based on physical and chemical changes
Use digital or print media to research applications of common elements and compounds
key_inquiries: How are elements and compounds different?
Why are elements and compounds important in our lives?
non_formal_activities: Interviews with professionals on element/compound usage

skills.skill: Ability to differentiate between elements and compounds

rubrics.Exceeds: Clearly and consistently differentiates between elements and compounds with examples
rubrics.Meets: Correctly differentiates between elements and compounds
rubrics.Approaches: Partially differentiates between elements and compounds

sub_strands.name: Physical and Chemical Changes
descriptions: Characteristics of physical and chemical changes
Differences between physical and chemical changes
learning_outcomes: Describe characteristics of physical and chemical changes
Differentiate between physical and chemical changes
Appreciate importance of physical and chemical changes in everyday life
learning_experiences: Conduct experiments demonstrating both types of changes
Observe and record results from burning, dissolving, mixing
Discuss applications of both types of changes in real life
key_inquiries: How are physical and chemical changes different?
Why are they important in everyday life?

skills.skill: Ability to distinguish between physical and chemical changes

rubrics.Exceeds: Clearly distinguishes and provides real life examples of each
rubrics.Meets: Correctly distinguishes physical from chemical changes

sub_strands.name: Classes of Fire
descriptions: Types and classes of fire
Fire extinguishers and fire control measures
learning_outcomes: Identify classes of fire
Describe appropriate fire extinguishers and methods
Appreciate the importance of fire safety
learning_experiences: Observe and classify fire samples (controlled)
Match fire types to extinguishers
Simulate fire response drills
Visit to fire department or virtual tour
key_inquiries: What are the different classes of fire?
Which extinguisher is used for each?
other_learning_areas: Linked to Social Studies and Life Skills
non_formal_activities: Fire safety campaigns or poster competitions

skills.skill: Ability to identify fire classes and use appropriate extinguishing methods

rubrics.Exceeds: Identifies all fire classes and matches correct extinguishers confidently
rubrics.Meets: Identifies most fire classes with correct extinguishers
rubrics.Approaches: Identifies some fire classes with guidance
rubrics.Below: Identifies fire classes with prompts and limited accuracy

sub_strands.name: The Cell
descriptions: Structure of plant and animal cells
Functions of cell parts
Comparison of plant and animal cells
learning_outcomes: Describe the structure and functions of parts of plant and animal cells
Differentiate between plant and animal cells
Appreciate the role of cells in living organisms
learning_experiences: Use microscopes to observe prepared slides of cells
Label diagrams of plant and animal cells
Create models of cells
Discuss similarities and differences
key_inquiries: What are the parts and functions of plant and animal cells?
How are plant and animal cells similar and different?
non_formal_activities: School science club exhibitions on cell models

skills.skill: Ability to identify and describe parts of plant and animal cells

rubrics.Exceeds: Clearly identifies and describes parts of plant and animal cells using appropriate vocabulary
rubrics.Meets: Identifies and describes parts of plant and animal cells
rubrics.Approaches: Identifies some parts of cells with partial descriptions
rubrics.Below: Identifies parts with prompts and incomplete descriptions

sub_strands.name: Movement of Materials In and Out of the Cell
descriptions: Processes of diffusion and osmosis
Importance of material movement in cells
learning_outcomes: Describe diffusion and osmosis
Demonstrate diffusion and osmosis using simple experiments
Appreciate the importance of these processes in living organisms
learning_experiences: Perform simple experiments with food coloring, potatoes, salt water
Observe and describe diffusion/osmosis in action
Relate to cell function
key_inquiries: Why are these processes important to cells?
pertinent_issues: Health and nutrition – importance of osmosis in body systems
other_learning_areas: Linked to Home Science and Nutrition
non_formal_activities: Project: Document osmosis in different food items

skills.skill: Ability to demonstrate and explain diffusion and osmosis

rubrics.Exceeds: Clearly demonstrates and explains diffusion and osmosis using real-life examples
rubrics.Meets: Demonstrates and explains diffusion and osmosis

sub_strands.name: Reproduction in Human Beings
descriptions: Human reproductive system and its parts
Fertilization and development
Hygiene and care during puberty
learning_outcomes: Describe the human reproductive system
Explain fertilization and development
Practice proper hygiene and care during puberty
Value human sexuality and personal responsibility
learning_experiences: Use models to label reproductive organs
Watch animations on fertilization
Role-play proper hygiene practices
Hold discussions with healthcare professionals
key_inquiries: What are the functions of reproductive parts?
How can adolescents care for themselves during puberty?
other_learning_areas: Linked to Life Skills and Home Science
non_formal_activities: Talks from health experts or peer mentors

skills.skill: Ability to describe parts of the reproductive system and their functions

rubrics.Exceeds: Describes parts and functions accurately with confidence
rubrics.Meets: Describes most parts and functions of the reproductive system

sub_strands.name: Transformation of Energy
descriptions: Types of energy (heat, light, sound, electrical, chemical, mechanical)
Transformation of one form of energy to another
Applications of energy transformation
learning_outcomes: Identify different forms of energy
Describe how energy is transformed
Relate energy transformation to real life situations
learning_experiences: Conduct experiments showing energy changes (e.g. battery to light)
Explore devices like generators, solar panels, motors
Discuss how energy transformation powers real world tools
key_inquiries: How is energy transformed from one form to another?
How is this transformation useful in real life?
other_learning_areas: Linked to Pre-technical and Business Studies
non_formal_activities: Project: build a simple energy transformation device

skills.skill: Ability to describe transformation of energy and its application

rubrics.Exceeds: Clearly describes multiple energy transformations and applies them to real world tools
rubrics.Meets: Describes most energy transformations with real life examples
rubrics.Approaches: Describes some transformations with limited examples
rubrics.Below: Describes few or no transformations with assistance

sub_strands.name: Pressure
descriptions: Concept of pressure in solids, liquids, and gases
Factors affecting pressure
Applications of pressure in daily life
learning_outcomes: Define and explain pressure in various states of matter
Identify factors that affect pressure
Apply understanding of pressure to real life scenarios
learning_experiences: Perform experiments with syringes, balloons, and weights
Measure pressure in solids, liquids and gases
Explore uses of pressure in hydraulic and pneumatic systems
key_inquiries: How does pressure help in real life?
pertinent_issues: Application of physics in sustainable engineering
other_learning_areas: Linked to Mathematics and Pre-technical Studies
non_formal_activities: Visit to local mechanic or hydraulic workshop

skills.skill: Ability to explain pressure and its application in real life

rubrics.Exceeds: Explains pressure clearly and links it to accurate real-life applications
rubrics.Meets: Explains pressure and identifies relevant applications
rubrics.Approaches: Explains pressure with some clarity and limited examples
rubrics.Below: Struggles to explain pressure or provide examples
